intro: Pouzolzia arabica, commonly known as the Arabian pouzolzia, is a flowering plant native to the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are typically greenish-white and appear in late spring to early summer. Pouzolzia arabica is often found in rocky or arid environments, adapting to the harsh conditions of its native habitat.
